title: How to Make Crystallised Angelica

steps.headline: Cut the stems into short lengths.
steps.description: Place the stems into a boiling pot of water. Leave to boil for 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the stems from the water and place on a dish.
steps.description: When cool enough to handle, peel off the outer skin; it should come off easily after boiling.

steps.headline: Return the peeled angelica stems to the boiling water.
steps.description: Continue to cook until the stems are very green. Drain the water.

steps.headline: Pour the sugar into a quarter cup of water and stir to dissolve the sugar.
steps.description: Place the sugar mix and angelica stems into a saucepan and boil in this syrup until the stems turn clear.

steps.headline: Cover a wire cake rack with wax paper or baking paper.
steps.description: Lay the angelica stems on the paper. Sprinkle the fine sugar over each stem.

steps.headline: Allow to dry.
steps.description: Put the angelica stems in a warm and clean place to dry.

steps.headline: Use.
steps.description: Once dried, the crystallised angelica is ready for use as a decoration or sweetener.

text: Cut the stems into short lengths. Place the stems into a boiling pot of water. Leave to boil for 3 minutes. Remove the stems from the water and place on a dish. When cool enough to handle, peel off the outer skin; it should come off easily after boiling. Return the peeled angelica stems to the boiling water. Continue to cook until the stems are very green. Drain the water. Pour the sugar into a quarter cup of water and stir to dissolve the sugar. Place the sugar mix and angelica stems into a saucepan and boil in this syrup until the stems turn clear. Remove from the heat.  Cover a wire cake rack with wax paper or baking paper. Lay the angelica stems on the paper. Sprinkle the fine sugar over each stem. Allow to dry. Put the angelica stems in a warm and clean place to dry. Use. Once dried, the crystallised angelica is ready for use as a decoration or sweetener.
